sentence.Network_en: He's a swashbuckler. He has such unbelievable charisma and energy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一个传奇人物，他的个人魅力和充沛精力让人难以置信。

sentence.Network_en: Onscreen, she lacks the vitality or charisma to pass this performance off.
sentence.Network_cn: 电影中的她缺乏演绎这出戏的活力和魅力。

sentence.Network_en: He was elected to power on the strength of his charisma.
sentence.Network_cn: 他凭借其个人魅力而当选掌权。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in sense 2): via ecclesiastical Latin from Greek kharisma, from kharis 'favour, grace'

encyclopedia.content: charisma [kE5rizmE] n. 超凡魅力， 感召力, 教皇般的指导力 在韩国的综艺节目《情书》中经常出现 charisma cha.ris.ma AHD:[k…-r¹z“m…] D.J.[k*6r!zm*] K.K.[k*6r!zm*] n.（名词） 【复数】 cha.ris.ma.ta[-m…-t…] A rare personal quality attributed to leaders who arouse fervent popular devotion and enthusiasm. 领袖气质：被认为是领袖特有的一种个人气质，能引起大众热诚的效忠或强烈的热情 Personal mag

entry.def: You say that someone has charisma when they can attract, influence, and inspire people by their personal qualities.

example.ex: He has neither the policies nor the personal charisma to inspire people.
example.tran: 他既无谋略又无个人魅力来鼓舞人。

means.word_mean: 1. a personal attractiveness that enables you to influence others

auth_sentence.content: He has got charisma but he is also down-to-earth.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has got charisma but he is also down-to-earth.

sentences.en: He could never be a film star;he’s got no charisma.
sentences.cn: 他决没有可能成为电影明星, 他一点儿魅力也没有。
